Posts.Content: on phone to old friend. She has been good during this, sending flowers etc. but I am still upset about something she said. So, I ( like all of us) have been and are going through hell, in fact most people's worst nightmare ( interesting, was listening to 5Live yesterday and they had a programme about cancer and said cancer is people's No 1 fear). Anyway, as I have mentioned before, I was very fit ( ran 10 k- 2-3  times a week) not overweight, not smoker etc etc - basically ticked all the non cancer boxes. Then get hit with this s*it from a great height in January.  so, my mate says "you know, even although I know what's happened to you, I still feel invincible- like this only happens to other people. You probably felt like that". Er no. I didn't. I watched a close friend die of this aged 29 so that is why i got my backside to the doctors. I came off the phone feeling shocked, upset and again, WHY ME?????? I knew this could happen, was alert and vigilant ( constantly checking under armpit for nodes etc) and I still get it. Just finished active treatment. Waiting on MRI's to assess pain in hip and groin. This  whole cancer thing will never I guess.
Posts.Title: so annoyed with crass comments

Posts.Content: i am37 and had a mastectomy 2 weeks ago then lymph node removal two weeks later. totally fine. Was only in for second op for one night. You will be fine. x
Posts.Title: X2 GA's 2 weeks!

Posts.Content: hi. i was diagnosed in jan aged37. you are in the worst place. it is so frightening and distressing but does get more manageable. keep posting here as this site is a huge help. I wish you all the best. All the best for you too Sassy. I remember results day well. x
Posts.Title: Post-surgery results and treatment plan ...

Posts.Content: hi lorna   wishing you all the very best. i will not forget how much you helped me that first awful weekend x
Posts.Title: MX tomorrow

Posts.Content: hi there- no, just the mx. i wasn't offer recon because they say they want the option to do radiotherapy if need be. i am not bothered actually. i just want this off. x
Posts.Title: Waiting.....

Posts.Content: Hi stevie I don;t know anything about this- I've just been diagnosed myself aged 37. Keep watching the boards thought as there are people here who are a tremendous source of strength. Always remember that your mum and you for that matter are not alone.   I really wish you all the very best x
Posts.Title: Chemo poisoning and shivers . . .

Posts.Content: hi there. i've beem diagnosed with ILC too. i had my mri last thursday and got results on tuesday. there was suspicious tissue in the other breast so had to have another mammo and ultrasound, but it turned out it was clear. the mri can throw up more questions so don;t panic- they just need to cover everything off. i have my mx on wed.   wishing you all the best. I am going mad with worry too about the results after the mx.   x
Posts.Title: Waiting.....

Posts.Content: yes- Lulu is correct: that's what i meant- I can have recon if i want but it will be delayed following treatment. sorry for confusion x

Posts.Content: I've just notice your pic is of your puppy . AWWWWWWWWW!!!! Ix x

Posts.Content: Awwww Annabel- I grew up with border terriers. I adore them. We were planning on having another baby before all this sh*t hit us. . That is not  going to happen now, so we are planning on getting a border once I am through treatment and we have had a holiday. My wee boy is 3. Borders are great with kids. I have such wonderful wonderful memories of our borders. The first lived until he was 13 and the other until he was 17. Enjoy your wee puppy x

Posts.Content: I've just notice your pic is of your puppy . AWWWWWWWWW!!!! Ix x

Posts.Title: Bought a puppy :)

Posts.Content: hi there for some reason i can't pm you. can you accept my  request and i'll let you know how i got on with the mx  xxx
Posts.Title: A good FEC experience!

Posts.Content: Hi joanne. yes- you are totally right,i think how it works depends where you live (i'm in scotland and treatment so far has been great) and also what they see / think from initial scans. Good luck with your results. I jsut want this waiting over to find out how many nodes I have.   XX
Posts.Title: Just new and looking for some help and advice please!

Posts.Content: no doubt others with much more knowledge than me  will be along soon, but I'll chuck in my tuppenceworth. Once the doctors have the biopsy and scan results back ( ie bloods, CT, bone etc) , these in conjunction with the finding from your mammo will give you your clinical diagnosis. What this means is that they will stage you out of 4 according to the results from the scans and biopsy. To be fair to the docs, they don't really have the whole picture until they have operated on you and removed the tissue and examined this under the microscope. The results of your op will be contained in your pathology report. Your consultant will meet with you  a week or so after the op to discuss the contents of the pat report. This will disclose size, type and grade of cancer as well as number of lymph nodes affected, and if there has been any invasion via the blood stream ( vascular invasion).  So, for example, when I pitched up at the clinic i got told on that day that they thought I had cancer ( MASSIVE shock). from the ultrasound and mammos they thought there were two tumors, on 17mm and one 15 mm, with DCIS and no nodes. Roll on a few weeks  after I had a mastectomy and lo and behold I had 3 tumors one 31mm, on 19mm and on 14 with 1 out of the 3 nodes they took out testing positive. I then had to go back for a full node clearance and i await the results of these. So, if they think nodes are involved then they will remove these along with the lump to avoid having to do two separate ops. If they don;t think any are involved they will take a sample ( called sentinal nodes) and if any of these are positive then you are back in for another op. I guess what I am trying to say is that the scans are not definitive. The nodes might just be enlarged but there has been no spread. I've seen ladies on here whose scans showed large nodes but no spread, but then there is cased like mine where the scans were totally clear ( i asked the radiologist to show me as I was so paranoid that first day) yet there has been spread. HAve they told you what size they think your tumor is?   To be honest, it does get better. Look at some of my previous postings and you will get a flavour of the state I was in. I just want these results on Wed to tell me how many nodes are involved so i can get this dam thing sorted and on with my life. I am 37 by the way with a 2year old, so don;t think you are alone age wise- there are quite a few of us. Have a look at the Breast Cancer care website too. THat provides alot of info. Ask your breast care nurse as well. Mine has been excellent and an immense support. This is truly an awful time for you , but you need to remember you are never alone in this. x x
Posts.Title: Just new and looking for some help and advice please!

Posts.Content: that's great news. you must be so relieved.   I'm just  back from the hospital and the consultant says that I basically need to get a grip and I am not the only woman to have breast cancer and wont be the last ( but in a nice way). he also said, yes , you are young, but I hate to say it, not that young.   I've been obsessing about it having gone to my nodes and he said the clinical team had look at it closely on a digitised display at their multi disciplinary meeting today and cant see any evidence at all of it having gone there so he said, "what are we to believe", you thinking it has gone there, or the scans? i then asked him what caused the cancer and he said there is a nobel prize waiting for me if i can work that out.   Chest x ray is clear. There you go, I had it in my head that my tumor had grown through to my chest wall and would show up on the xray, or they would say there are a couple of areas they need to investigate.   so, MRI, bone and liver scans on thursday. I have to say. the NHS in scotland have been superb.
Posts.Title: good news and bad news....

Posts.Content: i am so pleased for you. I have been thinking about you all day. I have MRI scans tomorrow and MX on 22/2. x
Posts.Title: Specimen results day, and BRCA question

Posts.Content: hi i don't post much on here  anymore but check in regularly. i am in edinburgh. was diagnosed last jan aged 37. there are, sadly, alot of us in both edinburgh and glasgow. there are monthly lunches which are great. your best bet is to get on face book and look up breast friends, ebeebies and gabbies- the edinburgh and glasgow groups. there are stacks of us as i say- so never think you are alone x x x
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: I finished my  last cycle of  FEC las wed and have never been so ill. Was vomiting like anything last week,  tried all diff anti sickness meds but they didn't work. Just up from  bed today but still feel awful. You know, nausea, heartburn tiredness. The other night i was awake all night. Did not get one wonk of sleep.  I had a rads planning appt at 9am the next day. I have  never felt so awful. Thought i was going to have to cancel. Husband forced me up and drove me there whilst i held basin in case i was sick and also had a pillow on seat to rest my head. Although i've finished chemo, whenever I think of it I heave. Big waves of nausea etc. Also been in floods of tears. This has been the hardest. I wonder if others found their last cycle the toughest. I honestly don't know how FEC can only be 4 /10. I've had pain, sickness, wall the hair loss, heartburn, ulcers, insomnia, hospitalised for 5 nights with an infection. Actually, i think I am a bit traumatised tbh x
Posts.Title: TIRED AND SICK WTH FEC

Posts.Content: hi sascha. I will call you. its just that I have been so ill with chemo ( hence the fact I've been awol)  I have been following your progress and you are doing so well too x
Posts.Title: TIRED AND SICK WTH FEC

Posts.Content: i am the same. got mx results yesterday- much more cancer than thought and less DCIS. Also lymph node involvement when ultrasound said they were clear.x
Posts.Title: out of hospital today and really feeling low

Posts.Content: thanks there are two invasive sites 15mm and 17 mm tumors. Don't know what I'm delaing with unitl see consultant on friday. until then my mind will run riot x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks just spent past couple of hours sobbing. i think i am in shock. just need to take things a day at a time . good luck to all of you. i am in edinburgh by the way x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks. I vae DCIS and two tumors on 17mm and one 15mm. doctor did say that it was early and the fact i had pain was almost incidental. on examination he didn't even feel anything and was totally shocked with the ulttasound and mammogram results.   he as good as said it was cancer- the biopsy is goin to determine grade etc. I am totally frighted about the full body scan in case they find i anywhere else, we were going to try for another baby but can't now and even if i get over this, then what is there to say that it wont come back when i am pregnant and where will we be then?   Anyway i look at this i feel as if I am looking through my life through a looking glass. I can see my wee boy and and husband and all my things but everything has changed irreverisbly.  I feel as if my days are numbered.totally desperate x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks. this webpage has  been my  lifeline this week. I was so in control of my life until fri. Up at 6am, tough high pressure job as lawyer ( in worst recession in 70 years!), nursery pick up, my boy fed, ( cbeebies in background) lunches made up for next day, tea on, ironing done, a wee bit of hoovering to keep things ticking over, trawling facebook,wee boy bathed, read to and, sung to sleep. When I hear In the Night Garden now I can't cope/   Now this. Chemo. breast cancer. nodes. TNM. daze. fog, fear. biopsy.   i know my feelings are normal but i thought id cope better.- I am absolutely not coping at all. I can't function and feel the weakest person in the world.   Benn trawling websites for multifocal breast cancer and prognosis.   What io will not be able to deal with is all those sympathetic words from folk , when what they are really thinking is "I am glad it is not me".    ps Do not go on facebook- i want to punch all those smug "life is great" entries
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thought i'd update everyone. Had MX and SNB on 22/2. Got results today. Not great. Rather then two tumors at 17 &15mm - I actually have 3 at 311, 19 &14mm. Also , although ultrasound showed clear nodes, SNB revealed 1 out of the 3 removed is positive for cancer. I am devastated. My worse fears have become a reality. The cancer is much more than thought and has spread to nodes. Have node clearance booked. Feel like i am back to square one and really  wondering what the point is in going through all this. Not only am i really young- 37 and lost an entire boob, the cancer is much more than initally thought. I can;t take much more. i really can;t x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: is this a good diagnosis do you think if there is such a thing as a good cancer diagnosis ?
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks lulu. you really know your stuff. best of luck to you x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks lulu. think my breast care nurse is fed up with me already!  you seem really well informed. are you medically trained at all? you really calm me down.   now formal diagnosis made starting to get texts and calls. people are shit scared and finding that hard to handle. no lablled as cancer patient it's almost like the black death x  i am a strong person and i know my true steely self will kick in and i will get through this. my heart is already going out to poor folks who get a cancer diagnosis in the future. Society has to do everything it can to eradicate it. Breast cancer can be and must be stamped out. mothers are the glue that keep families together . Multiply that across the uk and there is a huge problem for the nation's wellbeing.  ( not to say sending wee boy's out to nursery with odd socks- as hubby did the other day!).  BC should become either curable or a chronic disease. not a death sentence. and i am sorry, it is bullshit that screening is only for over 50's and  pain is not a sign of BC. Christ, I am 37, had no lumps, pain ( which I thought was menstrual)  that came and went and then disappeared entirely  for weeks on end. it was only my hypochondria and recurring dreams about impending ill health  ( volcanos with lava!) that made me go to gp. he didn't feel anything. consultant didn't feel anything.   do 10k runs every week.! BC does affect loads of under 50's and  the reason the prognosis for under 50's/ 40's is so poor is because of  the misconception that it won't affect them ; so by the time they present at clinic their disease is too advanced to treat.
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: hi lulu   i am in scotland so not sure if protocols are different up here. he basically said i can't feel anything but  you know your own breasts  and we will refer to "err on the side of caution" . I remember he specifically said that.   even the consultant at that breast clinic didn;t feel anything and said- "all normal breast tissue"( but in line with protocols up here at this point they still need to refer you for a mammo at that stage- that's when it all unravelled.    i think my sixth sense kicked in. Also I lost a friend to BC in 2003 aged just 29, so i knew it really could happen. perhaps her tragedy and suffering wasn't in vain  and through her pain and loss she has given me a fighting chance of keeping my life. x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: hi jamesy- that is exactly how i am feeling around babies. were were going to start trying for another one about now, but that isnt't going to happen.  when i get out of this shit i will be too old.  yeah they mentioned  maggies to me but what can they say? i cant get away from the fact i have cancer in my body and even if i get through this then it may still be floating about can come back to haunt me. I always wondered how people with cancer coped, but dismissed it from my mind as too painful to consider: now I am in that position.   i'm thinking of all the baby clothes i washed and ironed and put up the loft and all the baby toys we kept  for when we had another. last night i had one of those silent scream dreams- you know the ones where you are shouting out for help at the top of your voice, but all that comes out is a squeek.   i've not got as far as looking at nutrition etc. i've just been eating toast and drinking tea.   christ, when my wee boy was born he was seriuosly ill and was in neo natal intensive care - i thought i had had my shit, and now this.    i really am not coping at all and can't shake the feeling of doom off, or relax at at all. i cant watch telly or even the news.    you did really well at your wee girl's b'day party. that would've been so painful and you must feel robbed that you couldn't just enjoy the day without this hanging over you. You look at other mums and think why me.? why this? this is not happening. my heart is breaking every time i look at my wee boty. i was in his room last night watching him sleep and thinking about the day he was born and how  he came through an awful time and then we were so happy. the singing in the house has stopped. the dancing  in the house has stopped. the laughter has stopped. the music has stopped.   i never took my health for granted. was always so grateful when i was out running that i could do just that, and see and smell.   for the first time in my life i see nowhere to turn.   x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks for all the kind words  of support- it is really helping. i think i need to work through the shock , disbelief and despair, then there will be gradual acceptance and I will get through this.  x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks. all i am doing is trawling cancer websites and trying to work out the chances of it having gone to my nodes. 10cm dcis, 15mm and 17mm tumors. how can that be early???? got a ruler out today to see what those measurements looked like. i can't understand why my body is failing me. i have been good to it: never smokes, not overweight, moderate drinker, eat salad and fruit - loads of it. run 10k every week.    Got and 1phone 4s at christmas. wasn't out of my hands until friday. now i just look at it and cant bear to go near it because it reminds me of so many good times and I don;t want to contaminate it now. took wee  boy to playpark today but was in floods of tears when he was on the slide. seeing other mums who  were being so care free with their children was heartbreaking.    taking diazepan . x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: back from hospital. they have clinically diagnosed me as T1 multifocal lobular cancer Stage 1 grade 2 with DCIS . recommending a mx. I'm told it is estrogen + ve  grade 7/8 ( not sure what that means)/ He seemed upbeat that it was multifocal. Does anyopne know what this means?
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks Lulu.   I think all i really want the dosc to say is that you will be fine 100% but of course they cant. I am still shit scared and no matter what anyone says i am still shaking. Mentioned pain in my back to the doc today and he pressed it and said it was muscular.    The thing that is really putting the shitters up me is that they say the staging can changed once they\ve done the mx. Apparently my affected area is 10 X 8 and that this 3d ( not 2d). he said if they take the breast off they may find alot more and in nodes and put me to stage 3 which made me nearly faint ( ie it has become one BIG lump. i  collapsed into my hands and hunched up in the seat at this point). The breast nurse then said that becuase it is multi focal ( which they raved on about ) and lobular ( i sprinkeld about like sugar)  then this was unlikely- so whay did they tell me????? I then pressed him to establish how many changes to initial stagin they make a year and they said 1-2 which i thought was pretty good.   Breast nurse called this afternoon to say my bloods were ok ( they were testing for platelets and liver function). Gor chest x ray and I am shit scared about results of that. THey say ultrasound showd clear nodes and 10% chance of having gone in ,  but that is not full story unitl I get mx. I am physically shaking as i am typing. have taken diazeapm and that doesn't seem to be working. Bottom line is I have cancer in my body and I am absolutely not coping.
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: does anyone know how accurate ultrasound is. I am still obsessing and think i am beginning to lose my my mind. I have a pain in my wrist, under my arms  and also in my back and feel totally ill with worry.  the doc said yesterday that because  it is lobular they may remove the breast and lymph and find alot more cancer then move it to a stage 3? I am totally trembling and can't function at all. I can't even make a cup of tea. How can I get out of this mess?     wind back three weeks and i was saying to myself BC, now way, I am too young and it won;t happen to me. Now  I have been dealt one of the biggest blows you can take in life, I am now thinking there is absolutely nothing to stop them re staging my diagnosis and my entire body will be riddled with this. seriously not functioning. House is a tip, washing needs done, bathrooms a mess- amd my house is normally a clean as a pin.
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Day 14.Had the worst ever night last night - nearly  had a complete meltdown with worry dragged myself out of bed  at 7:30 ams today for the scans. I was told the liver and all other abdominal stuff look  normal. I was just waiting for that beep beep of them measuring stuff as happened in my ultrasound but that didn't happen.   bone scan is the worst thing ever- the waiting after you've had the dye injested etc is horrific.  The bone bod person was so lovely. I was in complete tears having the scan done. Both the breast care nurse and bone bod warned me in advance that they may need to take extra xrays  if they need to investigate  specific areas further not  because  of "C" but just but maybe because of degenerative condition / wear and tear  etc ( but you know the subtext is they are looking for "c". The bone care bod  then said when the scan was nearly done that she thought that unlikely because  it looks quite normal. So, I was chucked out , asked to wait in my gown in case they needed further  xrays etc. Then, they appear and say we don't need anything more - you are free to go. I'm hoping that is a good sign  because what I am beginning to learn is that any whiff of a suspicious area, they haul you back right away and investigate it- as per  the initial mammo / ultrasound etc.   I' m now just  beginning to see a glimmer of light in the dark hole that I am in that this might just have be caught in the nic of time.    x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: i am just constantly in floods of tears. keep thinking of my wee boy opening his pressies at xmas and that i might not be here for him. Feel as if i am in a nightmare- a really bad place. Disbelief, complete unmitigated fear. Have told whole family- but what can they say. everyone says be positive, you'll be fine., they've caught it early, but I had a mate who died of it at 29.I have been on websiters and I could have one of the most aggresive ones. Doc said i should have a masectomy because of spread of DCIS. How has this happened. don;'t know where to turn or what to do. exhausted with sobbing. x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks. i get the biopsy results on fri but doc pretty much said it was cancer. i am not eating, sleeping and i am just walking about in a fog and daze,. My wee boy peed for the first time in his potty tonight. I put on a front and made a deal about flushing it down the loo, but these cherished memories are obscured and marred by the this monster that is surrounding and suffocating me. Cancer has came into our home, uninvited, unwelcome and infiltrated every room and crevice on my mind and shattered our world to pieces. I don't know how I am going to cope. I always heard that if it has gone to your nodes then that's it. I have never ever experienced such absolute fear. x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: D day looming tomorrow... get biopsy results. i knwo it is c but  i am shit scared of what they will say about it, i will cope better when i know what i am dealing with. it;s the waiting i can;t handle.   i managed to put a  wash on today and load the dishwasher, which , other than trawl cancer websites, is the first thing i have managed to do since friday. y have ache in my back and mt wrist is sore so totally paranoid ....
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: hi folks bone and liver scan tmoz. I am now worrying why they are scanning me- do they think it has spread. I am going round in circles in my mind, Does this ever stop. I am frightened about the scan results already . Really struggling to get a grip on all of this. I question everthing the doctors say to me - they kept saying treatable and i said yes, but you r not saying curable?   Still in a daze to be honest and that is about 12days after this nightmare began. Finding dealing with "normality" an huge issue because I forget for a moment then there is this overwhelming realisarion that my life and health is in pieces right now.   Crumbled to the floor when I got back in fro tescos tonight and have really stopped. Trying to dela with fear of scan results fear of the op, fear of what they will find and also that i wont be able to have another baby ( NHS won;t pay if you have a kid already) . Huuby been great so far but is now telling me to get a grip but I am totally struggling. Not just dealing with grief of loss of health and another baby but all  the treatment and results to come. x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: HI FOLKS. Flower here. I started this thread off and wanted to update eveyone. Well, as they say, the results are in and have been verified. So, after my mastectomy my worst nightmare came true. The cancer was bigger than originally thought and i was  told the SNB was positive. Had ANC  and was DREADING the results. Found out that the only +ve node was the SNB so 1/10- the rest all clear. Was told I only need FEC ( not FEC-T). Life is stranger than fiction when you are celebrating that you have one cancerous lymph node!! x x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: went for examination yesterday. mammogram and ultrasound disclosed DCIS and also suspected invasive cancer. two tumors one 15mm and 17 mm. in inital exam doctir couldn't even feel them- said breast was normal. went to clinic because of pain. biopsy taken but consultant as good as said it was cancer. don;t know where to turn or what to do. can anyone help?
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: feel ill Life has been good to me- great job lovely husband and beautiful wee boy. Am stunned. Consultant seemed to think they caught it an early stage and from the ultrasound there is no evidence of it having gone to lymph nodes but i can t help thinking i still have cancer in my body and I am going to die.
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: thanks. been really down today. got diazepam from the doctors and sleeping pills to calm me down and help get some sleep. have spent time since diagnosis talking, reading and thinking exclusively about breast cancer.  called breast nurse at unit totally distraught. she said my dcis is 10cm and the two tumors are 17mm and 15mm- how can that be early????   have trawled internet to find out chances of cancer having gone to nodes if ultrasound is clear. they didnt bioposy my nodes- does anyone know??   i can handle losing my breast(s) and hair but i am absolutely totally terrified of it having gone to my lymph nodes.  they said my nodes looked normal on the ultrasound ( and i asked them to showm- look like an unopened lily), but there is no certainty ( if you can have such a thing) until after the op.   i am totally terrified. x
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi. I'm 37. There seems to be quite  a lot of younger ladies with BC. Maybe I am just noticing it now, but actually one of the factors that made me go and get checked was the fact that you hear about a lot of woman in their late 30's with kiddies getting this.. thank god i went.   I was diagnosed in Jan this year. Like you I was told i had small invasive areas ( 1.7 cm and 1.5 cm ) and no node involvement. I asked how often this can change from stage 1 to 2 and they said not very often. After my mx in feb, turns out I had three tumours, the largest being 3.1cm. and one node +ve, I was devastated. Had to have a further op to take out other nodes.   So, the results can change from initial scans. The docs just can't guarantee what is there until they check and remove the tissue. The point is  that whatever happens they will gear the treatment to suit your diagnosis. That dreadful day  of my initial diagnosis, they said to me i might not need chemo. Turns out i needed the works. In a weird way now, I am glad I am getting chemo because there is always the chance cells could get out- at least this systemic treatment is giving me a fighting chance of killing any floating about.  This is the worse time for you. it is horrendous- I've been there but once you get your results you will feel a bit better x
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed!

Posts.Content: hi. i went to the ivf clinic to find out about options open to me. they scanned me and found a cyst. I like you started to go into a meltdown. i asked the ivf guy if he thought it was cancer and he said no. I also got my gp to find out if we needed to do anything. I got a letter the other day saying it was a haemoragic (sp?) cyst. Cysts are really common and usually benign. great the mri picked it up though- shows you it picks up anything so if the rest of it is clear then that is great news x
Posts.Title: Pre chemo tests: ovarian cysts - now I am terrified the cancer is...

Posts.Content: hi Kelly. I am sorry you find yourself here. I am also sorry to hear the news about your Dad. Life really does deal terrible blows.    I was diagnosed in January this year aged 37. I have a wee boy who then was two and just turned three 3 a couple of weeks ago. All your feelings are normal- we have all been there. You find yourself in what I think is the worse place: knowing you have cancer but not sure where, what type, what treatments you'll need etc. I was absolutely devastated. There is a thread on this site which i started in january headed something like "aged 37 shock at  breast clinic yesterday.." you'll see from that the turmoil i was in, but more importantly the help i received from people on here . Cancer just isn't supposed to happen to you, is it? not at this aged anyway. Six months on I still catch myself thinking is this really happening? Anyway, since january I have been through a mastectomy, then node clearance op and I am now on chemo. I never thought for a minute this would happen to me. The point is you will get through whatever they throw at you. You might not need chemo, which would be great. Even if you do, you will cope. My boy has kept me going; yes even when I wonder if I will see him grow up. You will not feel like this now, but cancer does give you a new appreciation for life. We wanted another baby this year, but that is unlikely to happen because of the treatments I am getting. However, I am so grateful ( more than I was even) that I have a beautiful healthy boy who is thriving. you are just starting out and don't know where you are going yet. Things will become clearer when you find out more about your diagnosis and treatment plans. Have a look at my thread and see how much I have come on. You must believe me. I really wish you all the very best and hope that your Dad is as comfortable as can be. Keep posting all your worries here, x
Posts.Title: I'm new and just been diagnosed.

Posts.Content: Hi Folks. I was wondering about this too. Once i  get my ANC results on 21/3 we were hoping to go somwhere sunny for a week ( depending on when chemo starts). Should I start looking into travel insurance now do you think? x
Posts.Title: Easyjet plane travel - will there be a problem?

Posts.Content: hiya. Just emerging from  my 1st week post fec haze......... that's rubbish. To be honest I don't know how on earth you are managing to cope with work and looking after your wee girl. I am totally knackered and i am not joking, sleep most of the time. I've only had 2 chemos so not sure if this is a cumulative thing or not. Think it is more the fact of it being put back as means finishing line is further away. That said, it is surprising how quick it goes- probably 'cos i am sleeping all the time. Looking forward to that glass of wine with you and lulu when we are through this!!!! x
Posts.Title: chemo delayed a week ..so upset

Posts.Content: well done Amanda.! Jamesy, I honestly don't know how you do it.  i'm just back from a walk- 2 miles and first exercise i have done since my dx ( when i ran 15k a few days before!). Bumped into a bloke i  used to know from exercise classes  and he couldn't believe it was me in  a scarf. Poor bloke was totally shocked. Makes you realise just what an enormous thing we are all going through. anyway, feel much better from my walk. Saw a few neds and worried about them puling my scarf off but it went ok x
Posts.Title: chemo delayed a week ..so upset

Posts.Content: Hi- Lulu- Sascha is the lady I spoke with you about who lives abroad. Sascha Lulu is the lady I mentioned to you who is a breast nurse specialist and knows EVERYTHING !! x
Posts.Title: Getting there

Posts.Content: hi. i started on 11/4  (6xFEC) and felt the first waves of nausea 4 hours after treatment. Was sick as a dog the first night. called hospital next day and told to keep taking ant sickness meds. nausea and sickness subsided and eating a bit more now. have been in bed for past three days- just up today. feel totally washed out- as if i have just had a bug. been drinking loads of water and grapefruit and orange juice , so going to the loo been fine. no ulcers yet. been in floods of tears though. feel so low- as if i really have cancer. i am only 37, won't be able to have another baby and all in all just feel like i did at the start- the fear, despair. etc. also dreading the hair loss. i still can't quite believe this is happening x
Posts.Title: starting chemotherapy........

Posts.Content: hi- i start on wed too.  6 x FEC. had pre chemo appt today (nice Easter Monday!). Just waded through the list of side effects. I am just thinking of all the extra christmases  with my wee 2 year old boy this is buying me . Good luck to you both x
Posts.Title: starting chemotherapy........
